Reviews.Title: “A great hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Babsan01
Reviews.Content: Just visited Miami to go out on a cruise.Stayed at this hotel at the airport and and enjoyed it very much.Clean rooms ,super comfortable beds and a fun bar scene in the lobby.Food was good too so no complains and can recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at the DoubleTree”
Reviews.Author: EuroTexan
Reviews.Content: My first stay at the DoubleTree Miami Airport was very nice. Conviently located near the airport, the property nice (although they were undergoing some renovation while I was there). They staff were very friendly, especially the bar-tenders and they offered up an excellent buffet breakfast. There's also a large and very nice pool surrounded by a running creek and waterfalls. A nice place!

Reviews.Title: “OK stay”
Reviews.Author: mikerbiker
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable rooms, overall good experience Close to airport with free shuttle. If you are looking to see the sights of MIA w/o a rental car find something closer to where you want to go. No much around this property, no easily accessible mass transit. (I think airport had closest public bus.) Was approx 35-40 minutes from South Beach, $30 cab ride one way. About 20-30 min to downtown and port (did not time it). Save some $, there is a cafe au bon pain in the attached mall, cheaper than hotel breakfast. Keep an eye on your bill, I was charged twice due to computer error, and it took about 5 days and a few emails to rectify the charge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichiganLadybug
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. We arrived early for check in from a cruise and had to wait about an hour, not bad as the hotel was very full from the night before. The woman and the front desk was very nice and helpfull. The lobby was nice as was the pool and hot tub. The room was big and the beds and pillows comfortable. There was a dressing area as well as ironing board and iron. We order room service, the food was good but a bit over priced. We took the free shuttle to the airport and it was only 10 min. late. The only downside to this hotel is it is 20 min from airport and there is nothing near by it except other hotels.Also it is a bit overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Average Experience”
Reviews.Author: travel8363
Reviews.Content: Overall it was a good experience- the rooms were nice, the customer service was good, and the hotel itself was very nice. I had an issue with the sheets- whatever kind of detergent they use reacted with my skin quite badly. Also, the location of this hotel is not ideal- it really is not close to anything at all except for a CVS and some fast food restaurants. They did have great service from the staff however- definitely made my stay better.

Reviews.Title: “great beds, front counter staff and wait staff.”
Reviews.Author: Aussiewriter
Reviews.Content: Arriving after midnight into Miami Airport I wasn't too pleased to discover that the hotel only sends a shuttle tot he airport every half hour. Naturally we missed the shuttle by minutes! So we took a taxi to the hotel there is a local blue taxi service that only does the hotels and has a fixed rate of $15. There was some problemw itht eh computers when we checked in - by now it was well after 1am! So thefront desk lady offered a us a complimentary breakfast. The room was very lare and clean, the shower refreshing and we had a good night's sleep in their special sleepbetter bed or whatever it's called.. The breakfast was expansive. The coffee terrible. However I ordered a hot chocolate instead and it came promptly. I must say the waiter we had was very attentive. The hot and cold selection was great and we left sated. The shuttle back to the airport was speedy and we arrived well in time to join the long lines for security!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to airport, but not much else around”
Reviews.Author: JM_2793
Reviews.Content: The room was very nicely furnished. Large room with a modern bathroom. Hotel breakfast was very good and the lounge has a nice selection of drinks and appetizers. The location is a bit isolated on the south side of the airport because nothing is within walking distance. The restaurants are about a 10 min drive out to Doral.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for an afternoon”
Reviews.Author: sipleb
Reviews.Content: We were put up here by our airline for an afternoon after we got bumped from an international flight. We aren't used to staying at nice hotels, so it felt like we were in the lap of luxury. Huge room, flat-screen TV, high-speed internet, comfortable bed, decent restaurant on the ground floor. The check-in clerk was a little grumpy, but we have had grumpier. And we wanted to exchange a broken laptop at a Best Buy before our flight, and lo-and-behold, there was a Best Buy a short cab ride away! No idea about price, but if someone else is paying, we will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Sassysusie_11
Reviews.Content: We were there on Super Bowl Sunday so the bar was very busy though have to say really good food and amazing service . But be prepared to wait for the shuttle it runs about every half hour .

Reviews.Title: “Valet from another planet!”
Reviews.Author: Lotus L
Reviews.Content: When I write a review I try my best to be fair and it only reflects my personal experiences, however, this does not means that everyone it's going to go through my same experiences. I was visiting a friend that I have not seen for nine years and she happen to be in miami at a conference, so we made plans to see each other. I drove four hours from Orlando to Miami just to be able to spend a few hours with her. I tried getting a room at the same hotel, however, it was 100% full, but I decided to go up to her room and see her anyways. The VALET! that is if "I" can call this person a VALET... charged me $12 dollars for parking, when I asked him why was he charging me $12 dollars, he said that it was because I was staying overnight!!! I told the employee that No, I was not staying, he replied that I still had to pay the $12 dollars. I tried speaking to him in English and He didn't understand much...I spoke to him in Spanish and he said "Little spanish" and started laughing!! After so many minutes trying to talk to this employee I finally decided that enough was enough and that I just wanted to go see my friend. I took my car and parked it myself, because he said that I could do it, but with an attitude. funny, I paid for VALET parking, but I parked myself...OK..no problem. After spending about 30 minutes with my friend and after making plans for the next morning, I went to pick up my car and this same employee came up to me and said " I bet your car is saying...Let me go..let me go..., because YOU SURE DON"T DESERVE A CAR LIKE THAT ONE!!!!!!!!! I said "EXCUSE ME?"... The employee said, "Yea, this is a very nice car and you sure don't deserve it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!.....Honestly speaking I don't want to know the reason as of why in the world he'll say anything like that to me. Oh my God, was I fumming!! Yes, I was very upset, however,I kept my kool and did not say a word to him, however, time will come when he'll learn to respect and know the true meaning of "Customer Service." It's not going to be my doing the reason why this employee one day will find himself without a job, time will take care of it and his mouth is going to be the reason for his troubles. P.S ..The employee wasn't letting anyone park in the regular parking spaces... that is why I end up in 'VALET" parking!! I tried looking for management and no-one was available.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not clean”
Reviews.Author: Federico1981
Reviews.Content: It is a good hotel, the room is big and nice, the restaurant is good as the service and good meal. The very bad thing is the cleanliness! Very dirty, they must start to clean it up (not improove because seems like there is not housekeeping service). Very good the free Internet! I had been in a room on the 4th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Always falling short of expectations”
Reviews.Author: Trey B
Reviews.Content: Was staying here just before the Miami marathon -- I arrived at MIA and called for the complimentary shuttle. After 20 minutes, I gave up and took a taxi. The shuttle was still sitting out front when I arrived. No "I'm sorry" even offered. 1) Dinner: tried to eat carbs the night before the race. The pasta with chicken was absolutely inedible. It was a simple pasta, red sauce and chicken dish, but the pasta was overcooked and the cheese was terrible. 2) Called room service the night before to get some bread and fruit delivered the night before the race since I had to leave the hotel at 5:30 and breakfast wasn't served until 6. I was assured that I could call the next morning as someone would be in the kitchen to give me a banana and bagel. I was refused anything before 6 by two people. 3) Asked for a taxi to be called the night before for 5:30 departure for the race. No taxi was called, and it took over 20 minutes for a taxi to arrive. Room was very average, and there was no stocked refrigerator/minibar. There is also no complimentary coffee (or any coffee) in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Cookies were nice, but room smelled like smoke and no bath.”
Reviews.Author: Wayrachaki
Reviews.Content: The title pretty much says it all. The room (especially the bathroom) smelled like stale smoke, and the bathroom had the levers to take a bath removed. In its favor, the free shuttle was nice, and the service really good. The MACC burger from room service was delicious. The free Wifi was fast, too. Beds were great. In all, they sort of cancelled each other out, however, and I was expecting a little more for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Thoughtful and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Varsha N
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because my husband had to attend a seminar there. When we arrived there was some construction going on in the lobby. We were told that our room was not available, after having booked about 2-3 weeks in advance. We had to book a junior suite because everything else was fully booked. They wanted to give us a "regular" room and to throw in breakfast but we insisted on the junior suite. Finally We checked in and were pleasantly surprised to find little "goodies". We had a repair kit, shoe mitt, grooming kit, shampoo, conditioner, mouth wash, body gel and lotions. They even had complimentary razors, combs, tooth brush, etc. The wifi sucked, kept going in and out but all in all it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, excellent shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: bajoro
Reviews.Content: I stayed here between a late night flight and an early morning one. The hotel is undergoing renovations, but there were no inconveniences. The shuttle took us to a restaurant for dinner including a stop at a drug store. Nice breakfast options.

Reviews.Title: “Easy trip to MIA airport”
Reviews.Author: firsedge
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before trip to Chicago, Shuttle is very prompt picking up from airport - arrived 5 minutes after I called. Friendly staff at checkin which was fast (7.30pm) and welcomed with one of the great Doubletree cookies. Also given two vouchers for drinks/cocktails at the bar. Wifi worked well in my room, and breakfast was more than adequate. Quick shuttle trip to the airport the next morning. As noted construction is taking place within the hotel but this was not really a problem.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: palmret
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Older but well maintained. Staff was friendly and helpful.. Comfortable bed. the room itself was poorly laid out. Light switches were in odd places and I had to search for them. Closet is small. There is no place to hang up a dress. I don't think I should have to pay to park at my hotel. Free Wi-Fi worked great. There are no shops or restaurant within walking distance--you have to use the ones in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for our Pre-Cruise night”
Reviews.Author: LovedToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Sunday night before a cruise after winning this hotel via a Priceline bid of $85. We were a bit confused at the airport about where to catch the shuttle, but that's the airport's fault. Turns out there are several locations depending on where you come in, and you need to flag down the shuttle driver, which we had no problem doing. Five-star check-in. Gal was friendly and welcoming. Five-star cookies. I really am not big into sweets, but I confess I had a chunk torn off and was chewing in the elevator. I doubt seriously I'm the only one that can't wait to tear into that warm goodness! Room...fine. Perfectly ok. Clean. Sure it's an older hotel, but the bed was comfy, there were plenty of thick towels. Now, if you're like us and you show up with no car on a Sunday night, be aware there is nothing nearby. Even the shopping "mart" is closed. No big deal to us, as we were there for a restful night before our cruise. Fortunately, the hotel bar was open. Sadly, Happy Hour is not on the weekends. I wish every bar had happy hour every day! Bartender had a lot to do. He sure kept busy. We had some drinks and shared their sliders, which were good. You have your choice of 4: a chorizo one, turkey burger, crabcake & regular cheeseburger. We skipped the chorizo one and tried the other three. Turkey burger was my fave. Note to hotel: you might not want to leave a sign up by the register in the bar for everyone to see that says a VIP's name and what room they're staying in. That kind of guidance to staff should not be broadcast for all kinds of reasons, particularly security. We were tempted to say we were her staff and charge everything to her room :) (just kidding!) Anyway, later that night we came back down for dinner. I wanted something light, so I ordered the scallop salad for like eight bucks. Husband got the cheese quesadilla. I LOVED my perfectly seared scallops on perfectly dressed watercress. Not only was it beautiful (sorry, camera had run out of juice at this point, so sadly no pic), but it was absolutely perfect. Could not believe it was so inexpensive either! It was not a large salad, but it was light and delicious, and could not have been prepared any better! Husband, however, was not thrilled with his quesadilla as it was more vegetables and less cheese than he had in mind. (which means, I would've probably liked it). Back to the hotel itself...lobby-wise, there was a smell that really bothered me. My guess is it might've been largely due to the Shopping Mart that's attached to it. I couldn't quite put my finger on it, but the best I can describe is a cross between ivory soap and the way many import shops smell. They're obviously in the middle of renovations. Monday morning, there was a lot of window-cleaning and painting going on, which should lead to good things. Hotel shop gets my most unusual, tackiest hotel shop vote ever. If you've ever stopped at South of the Border in SC, you know what I mean. There was stuff in there I'm guessing have been there for decades that no one bought, no one ever will and they'll still be there. Like the "lawyers journals", sales pads, or the Tweety bubble bath? Then again, I might be wrong and they could be best sellers. TIP: If you're looking for the business center, it's an unmarked door. We asked two different people where it was, and they would say "it's right to the left", or "it's right around the corner", but no one ever said, it's a brown door with no sign on it. That would've been all we needed to know.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: aajean32
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Doubletree twice, in November and January and would recommend it to my friends. It is near the airport and has a number of high end shops and food court. The free wifi is a superb amenity which I always need.

Reviews.Title: “Wifi is slower than dial up.”
Reviews.Author: Kannscr
Reviews.Content: For the business traveler who has to respond to emails and access databases using a high speed internet connection, this hotel is NOT for you. The hotel is undergoing extensive renovations, which includes its communications infrastructure. Unfortunately that doesn't help a person traveling on business in January 2012. The wifi in the rooms is basically non-existent and they don't even offer an alternative of using a wired connection. There is free wifi in the lobby that is fair. The rooms are average. The hallways are damp and having a strange perfumed smell. I find the service at the bar and restaurant average. From what I can tell, there isn't very little in walking distance of the hotel. Once you are here, you are stuck unless you have a rental car or want to take the periodic shuttle. The staff is nice. The hotel is very near the MIA airport, fortunately you don't have air noise in the rooms. You can, however, hear your neighbors. It's a Doubletree- so you can count on the cookies being good.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mozabit
Reviews.Content: the carpet was covered with hair as well as pins. The bathroom was not very clean with hair in the tub and the floor. The bed sheets had hair too. We asked to change room and the receptionist was very friendly and moved us to another room which was unfortunately only slightly cleaner. She also offered us a complementary breakfast which was appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Brandon H
Reviews.Content: This was a nice place to stay while we visited Miami for two days, and took one day to drive to Key West. The rooms are clean, as is the overall property. Its typical of Double Tree standards, which we find to be quite good. The room was comfortable, clean, and very quiet. I like having a place to stay thats quiet in the evening. I didnt like that the rooms dont have internet access. You do have wireless in the lobby, plus pc's available in the business center. Parking isnt free, although I dont remember the rate. There are several fast food restaurants and a CVS/Walgreens down the street. Its very easy to get to downtown and the beach. We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad Not great --”
Reviews.Author: drjds71
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of it's location to the Miami airport and because they had shuttle service to and from the airport which is nice. The lobby was being modernized and looked like it will be nice in the future. The room was just average - not really clean -- the bathroom was quite dirty. The water was hot in the shower but the pressure was so low that it took 20 minutes to get the soap and shampoo off of me. The room size is nice but the windows don't open and there wasn't that much furniture in it for the size. The bed was average for comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Super short stay, very good experience”
Reviews.Author: Assenzio
Reviews.Content: On the way back from the Keys and with a very early flight the next morning, this stay was just supposed to be a super short overnight stopover. Everything went well, starting with the parking: a guy at the entrance (a parking guy? a bell captain? who knows..) actually let me park for free since I had to stay just a few hours: no pressure, a quick chat in spanish and he agreed. We were welcomed as HHguests with cookies through a very fast check in and we were given a room on the executive floor: excellent plus, since I used internet (and the printer) that night, which helped me a lot with a pending reservation I had to deal with. Again, free of charge. The room was spacious, modern and fully equipped at a reasonable price. Should I stay again in the proximity of the airport I would pick this hotel again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel to avoid”
Reviews.Author: MarkP4
Reviews.Content: As I missed a connection in Miami I got to experience this hotel and it's not one I would recommend. It starts with an airport shuttle service that only runs every 30 minutes and goes downhill from there. The evening shuttle was a small van so it got packed, no thought of sending another one. The hotel seems like its the furthest of the airport hotels too. Checking wasnt very friendly, didn't think it was worthwhile adding my Diamond HHonors number to the stay and then dumped me in a room with a broken security lock and a musty smell. Phone was blocked for 1-800 calls as they hadn't a credit card number on file. Breakfast in itself wasn't too bad but the mediocre service let it down.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place”
Reviews.Author: TravellerfromBermuda
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a few weeks ago when I had an overnight layover in Miami. I booked it on hotwire at a pretty reasonable rate. Compared to other places that I have booked on internet booking sites, this one did not require a credit card at check in. This meant that you could not charge anything to the room, which was fine since we were only overnighting there. The decor looks to be relatively new. They could probably have put a fresh coat of paint on the ceiling a and made sure the bathroom had toilet paper. Also the bathroom had hair all over it still. The hotel has ample parking which they charge guests for. This is a bit of a rip off since similar hotels in the area do not charge for parking. All in all, it was a good place to stay overnight. If you want a place with more to do around it then you should stay at a place that is not near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for biz traveler”
Reviews.Author: athensugadawg
Reviews.Content: Have gotten decent pricing for this property through hilton.com. Location leaves a lot to be desired, but it is convenient to University of Miami and surrounding area. Staff can be slow at times at check-in, but all in all, this is a decent value.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a four-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: CrystalAnn56
Reviews.Content: Please note: I am not that difficult to please, but I was highly disappointed in this hotel. My husband and I stayed here the night before our international flight out of MIA for our honeymoon. This was the only damper on our honeymoon, thankfully! Our first sign that this was not going to be a good stay was the fact that the parking lot attendant did not speak English. At ALL. Thankfully my husband speaks a tiny bit of Spanish or we could still be sitting there. Once we were out of the car, we were overwhelmed by the smell of jet fuel. It was nausiating. The line to check in was outrageous, people cutting and not understanding the concept of a line. The desk people did apologize and said they had several events going on and it was a crazy night. We got to the room eventually but it was not the cleanest as I discovered from I walking around without shoes and my feet turned a little black on the bottom. :( The room was better than the hallway though, which was littered with trash strewn all down the hall. I am pretty sure they hadn't vacuumed in at least two months. I was unable to sleep all night because I am a light sleeper and the sound of jets landing and taking off all hours of the night is impossible to sleep through. Our last straw with this place was the shuttle in the morning. We had returned our rental car thinking we could take the shuttle from the airport in the morning....nope!! We waited for 55 mins and the shuttle never arrived. It was supposed to come every 20-30 mins. We were afraid of being late and called a cab and got to the airport to find and huge line for our airline and narrowly made our flight. I would not stay here again unless I absolutely had to. The only saving grace was the room service....my husband thought the pizza was some of the best he's ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: williamH011
Reviews.Content: American Airlines put us here when they screwed up our return flight (11/27/11)....nice lobby, rooms a little run down and bathroom was dirty....but the staff here was amazing...I know if I had complained about the room they would have done everything possible...but being tired and angry at the airlines, I just wanted to eat and go to bed....but the front desk guy was so understanding and cool and the servers in the bar(only place to get something to eat) were so kind and helpful....I would seriously stay there again just because the employees were so nice...

Reviews.Title: “Great Double Tree Next to Miami Airport”
Reviews.Author: polarisdan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on Thanksgiving night and we used our Hilton Honors Points to book the room and were upgraded to a very nice Junior Suite. The room had a king sized bed with a large sitting area with couch and chiars. The bathroom was clean and nice sized. We didn't go for the breakfast buffet but instead ordered off of the menu and were both very pleased. The Bellman was very helpful and took care of our transfer to the cruise port the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Design123
Reviews.Content: This is a very large and impersonal business style hotel, with rather dated public areas. The room that we stayed in was also very dated though extremely large. The hotel was very adequate and well priced however whilst there was nothing to particularly dislike about the experience of staying there nor was there anything that was particularly appealing. The 3.5 star rating is probably accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Air and Sea Conference”
Reviews.Author: Donald147277
Reviews.Content: Was here for the air and sea cargo conference. Excellent service and accomodations. Close to Coral Gables and downtown. Never had any noise from the airport whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “lay over”
Reviews.Author: alaskan64
Reviews.Content: The shuttle wait was a little to long 45 minutes before the shuttle showed up. the hotel is tucked right up to a mall. There is a hall connecting the hotel to a mall. Unfortunately we were not able to go to the mall. We checked in close to 6 pm and the mall closes at 6 pm which we thoght was kind of stupid to close this early in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “An Up and Down Experience”
Reviews.Author: tripstyler
Reviews.Content: I fly out of Sea-Tac (SEA) multiple times per year and always stay at the tiki-70â€™s DoubleTree. The service is on-the-money, the facilities well kept and the experience consistent. I expected the same from the brand in Miami, but didnâ€™t totally find in every area. The hotel tittered between a classy DoubleTree and not-fully-up-to-par airport hotel. Hereâ€™s why: GOOD - I am forever indebted to DT for their chewy yet crispy and sweet yet savory {warmed} chocolate cookie. Aside from a ultra-luxe hotel I stayed at in Australia that offered guests Veuve Cliquot on arrival, DTâ€™s cookies are the second best welcome amenity! - Free wifi in lobby {good enough to make a skype call} - The front desk staff were greeted with a pontoon of people waiting to check-in and handled it with grace and care. They were welcoming and good customer service ambassadors. - The lobby bar, outfitted with oversized teal lounge chairs and high-top tables, had good food {sliders!} complimented by happy and efficient service. - My large room played host to a very comfortable king bed with a lounge chair and desk WHAT TO KNOW - Airport shuttle leaves the hotel at every half hour {on the hour and the half hour} hotel is about 15 mins from the airport - The hallway leading to my room was tattered and worn with gashes, marks and wallpaper tears in every glance. - Hotelâ€™s verbiage notes it is renovated, but the decor is confused, part of it is 70s, part 80s, part 90s - My roomâ€™s cleanliness was highly questionable: carpet dirty {not vacuumed, particles all over it}, drain not working, bathtub dirty {soap grime ALL over drain}, stain on bed covers and shower curtain had pulls and large pills all over it. All in all, the hotel's maintenance and lack of attention to detail was its biggest shortfall. - Doors not soundproof, bring earplugs

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be refurbished, and stay away from the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Martin334
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at the Doubletree MIA airport, attending a conference in the adjacent conference center. It works as a basic hotel to overnight at, but badly needs an overhaul. Interors in some brownish 70s style, maintenance has not been kept up (e.g. fitness room entrance door has no handle, carpets old.etc etc). Poor noise insulation between rooms , I could hear my neighbour talking in his sleep, I later responded with some heavy snoring...Made the mistake of having dinner in the hotel restaurant, waiter got the orders mixed up and eventually served the worst burger I have had anywhere. What's good? My wifi did work fine, and service in the bar was good. All in all, if you have a choice, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff-OK hotel-WIFI drives you mad”
Reviews.Author: KPEngland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights as I was attending an event at the adjacent (100yd covered walkway) conference and exhibition centre. Room was good size and everything worked OK. Hotel claims to be "completley new" well it may be completely refurbished but new it isnt-bathroom was smaill and old fashioned but everything worked well. The gym is much better than many hotel facilities-take your own amenities if you use the shower but better go back to your room. WIFI was probably the slowest ever experienced in the room-lobby was fine but rooms and the exec lounge have such slow speeds its simply not possible to work. But best to the last -the staff were quite outstanding-every contact I had was well handled by friendly smiling people-Gina in the exec lounge-Martha on the front desk-Simone in the restaurant took great care to find vegetarian options for my colleague and Raul on the Concierge desk was very helpful and knowledgable-even found me iced wated when I said I was hot after the gym-outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Room”
Reviews.Author: digtravel
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our young son stayed in this hotel for 2 nights prior to flying home. The circumstances of our stay were not good, as my son was recuperating from a serious illness. However, the Doubletree was just what the doctor ordered. We enjoyed the spacious, quiet room, terrific (and reasonably priced) room service both nights, the shuttle bus and the pool. After spending a week sleeping on a reclining chair in the hospital, the king sized bed was heaven. The hotel provided a nice travel crib for my son, and the room was clean and spacious enough to allow him to play comfortably on the floor. I used the shuttle bus to head into town to a drugstore where I was able to purchase some snacks and drinks. We also used the shuttle to get to the airport. All in all, it was a terrific end to a scary trip.

Reviews.Title: “A second look”
Reviews.Author: Oneness1
Reviews.Content: Not impressed as before. For starters renovations being done and wasn't inform prior to making reservations. I have stayed here maybe close to five times. Staff was just average. The bar staff was wonderful and food was tasty. The rooms are modern but the viewing of quite of number of channels kept dropping, which was most annoying. The most awful experience is that the internet connection kept dropping in the room, so I was forced to sit downstairs to get some decent service.

Reviews.Title: “Under Construction-Service too”
Reviews.Author: elizharrington
Reviews.Content: It was a mess from my arrival to my departure..but the staff did everything they could to fix it and offer specials and at the end the supervisor cut the bill 50%-now that was impressive! Overall the hotel needs a overhaul but the staff was friendly and helpful. Upgraded to Executive Floor..paid extra and was appalled at the lack of extra care...arrived late so food was picked over and no wine served...messy and dirty with no attendant in sight. Did not improve during stay. Had NO internet service in room-OMG! apparently it is spotty throughout hotel..so watch out if you are there on business and need internet! Service incredibly slow or non-existent in bar area. Restaurant was good with healthy choices, and friendly fast service. Concierge and valet staff VERY helpful and pleasing. Room was great with good amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great place!”
Reviews.Author: lessnow59
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had to stay over in Miami due to an American Airlines snafu. Unfortunatley, we were placed in the DoubleTree Inn. By the time we arrived, the only food choice available to us so late in the evening was the bar. The inept workers in the bar left much to be desired. Saul acted as if he hads never worked there before. He could not complete one task and he was off to the next. Very unorganized! After waiting over one hour for chicken quesadillas and a grilled chicken sandwich, I have to say the food was excellant. Or maybe it was because it was almost midnight and we hadn't had anything to eat in about 10 hours. The breakfast buffet the next morning was $32! Insanity! We didn't take advantage of the pool, as we were trying to get the heck home. The room had an old banana peel left in the trashcan when we arrived so the whole room smelled like old banana. It was gross! The cleaning staff does not know how to use the want to dust in the corners or behind the desk, etc. The room was large but who cares about that? The fan in the bathroom just makes a lot of noise but doesn't really vent the steam out. It also had a lot of dust cakes around it. I would highly recommend staying away. Oh, and we didn't even see a hint of their famous chocolate chip cookies. Go figure!

Reviews.Title: “It was free for me and it was still horrible!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy S
Reviews.Content: AA put me up for the night. Had to change my first room because of smell and smoke. New room remote didn't work. I went down to get batteries they told me they would send someone up. Took them 80 min to show up after 4 calls to tell me tv doesn't work. No net and when I called they transferred me to tech and I hung up after 20 min of waiting. Called front desk back and they told me the were hacked and all the net has had issues for 2 days now. There is trash outside my door. The worse part of the whole thing is when I plugged In my phone there is a huge hair ball, huge, with tons of tiny hairs and trash right by the top of bed on the floor. I have been waiting here for about 30 min for manager to show up and see it, still nothing. Never will I stay at a double tree again. Ps. There is construction downstairs make a ton of noise at 8 am. Not good!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Such a nice and warm place”
Reviews.Author: infinite287
Reviews.Content: Its great!! So close to the airport, but still so quiet! Very large and spacious rooms.. if you got kids, they could use all that space for playing! :) They have a great movie selection and Nintendo (for a nominal price ofcourse).. They need to work on their service part a bit, but otherwise its great! I loved the rooms and all the space. I also loved the toiletries :) Currently they are renovating, and the lobby is a little cramped up.. also they dont have free parking. Valet is $12 and self parking(which is kinda far) is for $7 overnight. Its better to give for valet if you got luggage or kids.. Overall I would certainly recommend it for a night stay.

Reviews.Title: “FOR THE $$ U CANT COMPLAIN....... BUT”
Reviews.Author: robbase75
Reviews.Content: If your on a budget this is the best place to be. The cookies help to. Its locateed by the airport and most of all you cant hear the planes, your right by the freeway to take you to Miami Beach which is only 10 mins away, and again the cookies help to. The rooms are nice the beds are very nice, just dont look for good service, a lil lacking, my last trip I waited for 4 hours to check in. Not cool at all

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but Service is not their Strong Point.”
Reviews.Author: crazyhotelguy
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel on a Friday night via a bump from Delta. Since I am a high level Hhonors member, I had asked for this hotel vs. the other options Delta had offered.... Check in was fairly quick, despite a shuttle full of guests arriving at the same time. I was a little shocked not to receive a cookie at check in, but I really did not need it. They are usually quite good though.. My room on the 2nd floor was quite large. I had a king size bed and a balcony. Room was comfortable and quiet. Room was clean and everything seemed to be in working order. I decided to visit the lounge to unwind with a couple of beers and dinner. The lobby is under construction so the ambiance of the lounge is not great, but the finished parts of the hotel look pretty good. Upon arriving in the lounge, I noticed they were not very busy, so I chose a table and sat down. After being ignored for over ten minutes by the bar tender who frequented the table next to mine, I chose to sit at an open seat at the bar. I finally got their attention, but the service was mediocre at best. The real fun began the next morning when I decided to dine in the restaurant. After being shown to my table, I encountered one of the rudest waiters that I have seen in a Hilton branded hotel. While the plates were cleared, the issue that I had was his attitude about the bill. Rather than presenting me with a bill to sign to my room, he came to my table and proclaimed in a loud voice "6.60". I knew that my food vouchers had covered a portion of the bill and was prepared to sign the remainder to my room. He continued his "6.60" banter and I asked for the check to sign. This made him say in an even louder voice "no you must pay NOW" He claimed that I could not charge to my room due to not having a Credit Card on file. Had I paid cash, this would be true, but it was very wrong in this case. I had a credit card on file and had charge privilages. He went to the POS and printed me a check to sign. No apology, no explanation. I am not one to make a scene and basically sat there stunned at what had transpired. Of course my mind wandered as to how many people in the otherwise quiet restaurant thought that I was some low life trying to skip out on a breakfast buffet. I did not make a scene and chose to leave the restaurant without further comment. I did however make a trip to the front desk to report the incident. The supervisor apologized and was very professional. Upone leaving the hotel, I was still a bit upset and managed to leave my belt laying on the desk in my room. I called the hotel a number of times the next day to see if I could retrieve it. Twice I was called back with people saying that they would check to see if they could located it in housekeeping, but twice I never received a follow up. I have since given up as it is a waste of time. In summary, the hotel is going to have a fresh new look after the renovation. Things seem to be coming together. However, the current service levels do not match up to the physical accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Forgetable One Night Stay!”
Reviews.Author: NVDave1
Reviews.Content: This is the worst Doubletree Hotel I have ever stayed in. The property is run down, worn out, dark, and dank. The staff was friendly, but their friendliness was overshadowed by the very poor condition of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Retreat Experience”
Reviews.Author: Crystal P
Reviews.Content: Our organization had a wonderful retreat experience! The hospitality of the staff and Catering Manager Robert was subperb. Any and all accommodations were satisfied and the food selections were outstanding. Hotel check-in staff (Karina) they were very friendly and responsive to our needs. The meeting space was adequate and the facility was very clean. The staff assisted us in setting up and breaking down for the various workshops. Just an overall wonderful experience. We look forward to next year's retreat at the Double Tree.

Reviews.Title: “This was a beautiful hotel with great amenities”
Reviews.Author: lphinizy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night only and had ti check in very very late because of the time our flight arrived. The staff was very understanding and held the room for us. We checked in and were given the best chocolate chip walnut cookies ever!! The room was so beautiful and clean and spacious!! My husband and i slept very well and even after our cruise in and out of Miami, we are still talking about our hotel stay!!

Reviews.Title: “nice place.”
Reviews.Author: lmr123012
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfy hotel. The rooms appear to be recently updated. The bed was very comfortable. The service was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel, staff a little distant”
Reviews.Author: TrellisTrinidad
Reviews.Content: Restaurant excellent, go for the set meal for 2 best value. Italian waiter best assett the hotel has. Check in staff had a bit of attitude. Did't like that I left without signing to agree the final costs on my room Left 2 hours before check out, anyone could use "my" facilities, but when I asked what proof I had she said "I am your proof, we do not do that sort of thing". Room excellent bed great food lovely .well worth booking in to just for the shopping centre around the Hotel. Allow a few hours to see it. Good spa nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Decor, Average Service; Overall, Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: I did not have a good start to my experience at this hotel. I checked-in at the desk and was issued 2 keys for a room on a high floor. I went to the elevators, which required a room key to use. My key didn't seem to trip the elevator, but another person got on and up I went to the floor to which I was assigned. I should have known -- the keys I was issued did not work on the room. So, I went down to the front desk, waited in a short line, and explained to the clerk (the same one who checked me in) that the keys didn't work. She then gave me new keys; when I got to the elevator and swiped this key, I was swept to a different floor than the floor of my room. I couldn't even access the floor my room was supposed to be on. I went to the desk a THIRD time and upon seeing that the same clerk who had screwed up twice was still working, asked to speak with a manager. Turns out, my actual room was on YET ANOTHER FLOOR (in fact, my actual room was a different one altogether than the one listed on my registration packet). The manager gave me a correct set of keys. He called me a few minutes later and explained the root of the error was a front desk clerk who just did it wrong...twice. He apologized and reduced my room rate, which was decent service recovery, but it would have been a lot better if the front desk staff were trained to check people in accurately (which seems like a pretty baseline skill for someone who works at a registration desk). Set that aside, and the stay was OK. The hotel is attached to a massive convention hall, and the property seems to be in the midst of a HUGE renovation project. The hotel part seems done, and indeed the lobby and the room had nice decor, good furniture, nice bedding, etc. The hotel's pool is a major disappointment. This isn't by the beach or anything, so I wasn't necessarily expecting a glamorously landscaped pool...but it IS Miami, which is a pool-going town. Well, the pool might as well be at the Holiday Inn in Des Moines -- it's small, surrounded by ugly concrete, and totally uninviting. I was on a concierge floor because of my Hilton HHonors status. Fine if you get upgraded, but NOT worth paying for. The evening appetizers in the lounge were pathetic; basically, a tray of vegetables with some dip was put out. Breakfast wasn't anything special, either. It's an airport hotel, so you can't knock it for location very much...it's close to the airport, and that is about all. Don't stay here expecting lots of nearby restaurants, etc., unless you're really into fast food. Overall, blaaaaaaaah. Once they actually figured out how to check me in, it was fine, but as business takes me back to Miami and I need a hotel near the airport, I'd certainly be willing to stay elsewhere before rushing back here.

Reviews.Title: “Rude customer service...dry blood on the bed sheets!”
Reviews.Author: iflyaplane
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for one night as me and my wife were leaving to the Port of Miami for our honey moon. From the beginning they were extremely rude, hard to understand and lacked organization. The first night we found dried blood on our bed sheets. Instead of acknowledging the problem, they tried to blame us, since their housekeeper "personally inspects every sheet in the hotel". We did not even get a apology. Next time I'm going back to the Hyatt, it might be a bit more expensive but at least it is closer to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: D-Girl313
Reviews.Content: The Double Tree by the Miami airport was just okay. I didn't have the highest expectations, since I "won" the room on Priceline. I'm beginning to think that all hotels that participate with Priceline have "Priceline" rooms. The Good: * The service - anytime we requested something that request was honored. Also really enjoyed the complimentary delicious cookies * Location - we were close to pretty much everything. We drove no more than 15 minutes to get most places. The Bad: * The bed: ATROCIOUS! It sank down VERY low every time we sat or laid on the bed. It was very uncomfortable. My feet were above my head while laying down. They really need to invest some money in upgrading the "Priceline" beds. * The bathroom: It would have been nice. They have beautiful vanities and marble walls. However, the nooks and crannies look BAD. I will attribute it to either bad caulking or poor cleaning. * The pool: There was yellow crime scene tape over one portion of the pool and the whirlpool was not working while we were there. Also, the pool had no security, meaning any person that paid for parking could come into the pool area with no restrictions. There were also a lot of bugs in the pool. * The hallways: On our floor the hallways were always filthy. They were littered with crumbs, food and trash. It took 2 days after our arrival for the mess to be cleaned and they never stayed that way. * The view: HORRIBLE! Our view was of the 836 highway and air conditioning units that looked broken. * The parking: $7/day and there were several times we saw large pieces of animal feces in the parking lot. * The free wifi: It barely worked in our room. Overall, the stay was okay. I would never stay here again and it's made me re-evaluate my use of Priceline. This is allegedly a 3.5 star property. I felt safe enough and the rooms weren't filthy, but I definitely wouldn't label it right under a 4 star. If you're thinking of paying full price for this property, think again.

Reviews.Title: “Average Facility, Sub-par Service”
Reviews.Author: whimz
Reviews.Content: I felt compelled to write my first review on TripAdvisor after our stay this past weekend at the Doubletree Hotel & Convention Center by the Miami Airport.We stayed the weekend as part of a large group that was holding an event at the convention center adjacent to the hotel. I believe this hotel and the convention center have undergone a recent renovation. This was evident in some of the common areas and in the convention hall. In my opinion, the best features of the hotel are the icy-cold A/C and the refreshing shower (although the tub/shower certainly did not seem to be part of the renovation). Unfortunately, almost everything else about our stay was less than stellar. Like other reviewers, the pronounced lack of service, in all areas of the property, was baffling. Considering this property is billed as a convention hotel, one would think that customer service would be AT LEAST average. However, things like overflowing garbage containers, litter in the stagnant water of common area water features, garbage in the pool and jacuzzi, extremely limited food service, nearly non-existent housekeeping service and critically low-levels of linens are critically important to a property that is supposed to cater to large groups. The GM of this property needs to get it together and find and retain some high-quality service personnel immediately if they want to stay in business.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough...”
Reviews.Author: Pardal_Brasil
Reviews.Content: I was looking just for a place to sleep in a short trip to Miami. Got a very good deal at Hotwire. Pros. The free wi-fi and the express check-out were very handy. The Room Service was good and not so expensive. The parking fee is also not expensive. Negative The room was not so great. Good bed, though. No minibar in the room and the Ice machine in my floor didn't work. The vending machine in my floor only sell soft drinks. No water. To sum up, a good place to sleep for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room, but the extra "fees" are too much”
Reviews.Author: nursesar
Reviews.Content: This was a Priceline winning bid so I can't complain too much, but why do hotels think they have the right to charge parking fees and wireless fees to their guests. I think this one was $7 a day for parking. Wireless internet was not free. The room was very nice and clean. Bed was very comfortable. Bathroom was a little cramped. They have a lot of convention business here, so the parking lot can be full in the middle of the day. I didn't notice much airplane noise even though the hotel is very close to the airport. We could see the runway from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Luxury and Superior Service”
Reviews.Author: Vince33602
Reviews.Content: There is nothing worse than trying to get a last minute Hotel room in Miami during Spring Break. If you can find an available room it's either in a not so great hotel or double what you would normally pay or both! That's why my recent stay at the Doubletree Miami Mart Hotel was so unexpected. From the moment we drove up and was greeted by the bellman we knew this hotel was better than we could possibly hope for. Great customer service is the cornerstone of this hotel. From the Bellman to the Front Desk personnel to the Lounge Staff to the Housekeeping crew, everyone there was professional, friendly and efficient. The lobby, the restaurants and lounges were beautiful and the room itself was nicely appointed. If you need to do some shopping the adjacent Miami Mart was an unexpected bonus. Wow!, what great deals on merchandise (planning a return trip to do some Christmas shopping). All in all, it was a great experience, BTW the price was very reasonable, especially for the level of service!

Reviews.Title: “Room for Improvement”
Reviews.Author: MissingOrion
Reviews.Content: The concierge and front desk staff were quite friendly and helpful, and the breakfast buffet was a great buy. However, this hotel has a few customer service issues. First, they were overbooked and we were put up in another hotel for the first night. Fair enough except we had prepaid for the parking and we could not get a refund. Turns out that the parking lot is managed by another company. Second, the bathrooms needed more attention from housekeeping. The sinks had a heavy film of grime, the towels were gray, and the facial tissues were not replaced. Third, a frustrated room service employee informed me that I could not order from the menu my room had and he would send me a new one. He sent up a menu just like the one I had except he had ripped out all of the middle pages. The staples were opened up to prove it and the booklet was rumpled as though someone mishandled it. When I called back to place an order, another room service attendant informed me that all foods from the original menu were available and he was sorry that I was told otherwise. I told him I hoped the disgruntled guy wouldn't be cooking my food. Fourth, one of our rooms was canceled a day early. We managed to get it sorted out after a lengthy discussion and proof that we had prepaid. The hotel laid the blame on Priceline, although I am not sure how they could do that when we confirmed our dates at the time of check-in. Lastly, we couldn't leave without one last bit of drama. The hotel was very nice about letting us checkout 3 hours late at no additional cost. However, the parking attendants made us pay 70 percent of the full cost of another day. Needless to say I was not pleased considering they owed us for the first night we didnt get to stay there. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to individuals who need the convenience of the location and safety of the hotel over other features.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and outstanding food made for a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: OKDear
Reviews.Content: I was here on business, and was impressed with the service and amenities. The restaurant is excellent - the ginger salmon was amazing, and other food over four days was uniformly excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed for an American Airline refugee”
Reviews.Author: ConvertibleWoman
Reviews.Content: We were stranded at Miami airport because we missed our connecting flight due to AA mechanical problems, so they put us up (with a lot of other people) at the DoubleTree. The room was very clean and the bed was super comfy, they had free wifi so we could check our emails having flown in from out of the country. We ate at the restaurant in the hotel; it was quite pricey (even after the AA food vouchers) but it was pretty good. It seemed like it was a few miles from the airport but it appeared to be in a decent location. If I need lodging in that area again I would definitely look into staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great One Night Stand”
Reviews.Author: mikeswine
Reviews.Content: My wife & I booked an overnight stay to make a plane connection. After a short hotel shuttle ride, we arrived at noon. The hotel had no problem accommodating our early arrival (including the warm chocolate chip cookies). We had a wonderful lunch at the hotel bar (spicy shrimp and an antipasto plate) and spent the afternoon lounging by the pool and garden area. When we asked at the bar about a seafood restaurant we had heard about, Brian, the hotel food and beverage manager offered to make the reservations for us. We opted instead to dine in the hotel's restaurant and had a wonderful seafood dinner. From Brian, the food & beverage manager, Fabian, the bartender to the room maid who went out of her way to get us more decaf coffee, everyone was friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed and very satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: BGIWorldTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hilton Doubletree property for one night while travelling intransit through Miami International Airport. The hotel operates a free efficient shuttle service every 30 minutes between the airport and the hotel. On arrival, I was met by very warm and welcoming bellhops of whom one assisted me with my suitcase. Check-in was fast and efficient, very friendly clerks. I stayed in room 613, on the 6th floor, very nice views through the windows. The room itself was incredible. Very large and spacious. Flat screen tv, coffee makerâ€¦ basically all the usual perks. No minibar though. I found myself lucky in that I managed to connect to the free wifi connection from my room. I was told it was only accessible in (public areas) the lobby and restaurants, but obviously this isnâ€™t the case. I ate at the restaurant for breakfast and dinner. Enjoyed both meals. The breakfast buffet was to a high standard, as is the case with many other Hilton properties Iâ€™ve been to. Ranging from French toast, scrambled eggs, cereals, pastries, sausages, bacon etc. Just $14.17 USD including tax per person. This hotel is the total package, conference facilities, business meetings, overnight stays while intransit, you name it. My only regret is that I didnâ€™t get time to relax in one of the two swimming pools. I have found no bed bugs, fleas or ticks as some of the other reviews have suggested exist. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: wick1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before a Christmas cruise on Celebrity. The hotel offered transfer to the pier which was nice. Also stated that they offered free shuttle from the airport. After waitinig for 30 minutes we contacted the hotel and they advised we would just have to wait upstairs til they came back. They could provide us with no ETA so we took a cab. Got to the hotel and both the shuttles were sitting there parked. We tried to eat downstairs but at check-in we were told only the bar would be open for 1 more hour, it being 10 pm on a Friday I thought that was strange but didn't ask questions. We ordered room service which was normal hotel food. The hotel is attached to the Miami mart which is just a junk mall. Breakfast was decent but not well stocked. When they put out new food it was a dash to get any of it, turn over at the restaurant was quicker than the bus boys could handle. Overall the rooms are nice, but the hotel is to big for the current staff.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: mzanders
Reviews.Content: We were here for two nights before heading to the Keys, and enjoyed our experience greatly, especially compared to the mediocre Marriott down the road. The staff is pleasant and helpful; the only nice people we met in Miami were here, with one exception. The rooms were nice, clean, and spacious. Internet is free and the fitness center was above the average. We didn't eat in the restaurant, as the cafe next to it with the buffett was so good and reasonably priced ($12 including beverage). The decor is quite nice; on one visit the team of bussers/servers forgot about us for a long while, but otherwise the service was good. I really hate paying for parking, especially at a place that I'm already giving business to. But this is Miami, where it's the less-than-charming custom for just about any hotel to do so. At least here it's cheaper than most at $7/day. They didn't push valet on me, and the lot is right on the side of the hotel with easy access to the side door near the pool and restaurant; not sure what another reviewer means by a far away lot.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly decent for the price”
Reviews.Author: DFHoppin
Reviews.Content: Got a smokin' rate thru Hotwire and then learned I'd booked at the Doubletree. Looked up the hotel on TripAdvisor and was a bit concerned by the reports about bedbugs. Actually found the hotel to be perfectly fine. Definitely dark interior that could use a major refurb, but everything worked (including free high-speed wireless internet throughout the hotel), staff was friendly and it's convenient to MIA airport. Would do it again for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “There were bedbugs in my bed and I was bitten”
Reviews.Author: Pupo13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on January 17 and woke up to see I had been bitten by bedbugs and the sheets were spotted with blood after I killed them. Two were small, about one eight of an inch and another one was much larger, about half an inch. The incident was reported, they came to the room to take some pictures and I filed a report. I did not expect this as the Doubletree was supposed to be a high end hotel. I do not recommend this hotel at all, as the personnel was indifferent to my complains.

Reviews.Title: “Great for stay near airport”
Reviews.Author: Redwhine21224
Reviews.Content: We spent a night here due to an airline travel voucher, and were very pleased with the accommodations and customer service we received. The bar normally closes at 11pm, but Theresa kept it open another hour because there were so many patrons. Wayne in the restaurant was super friendly, and the breakfast buffet was excellent- really fresh fruit, and good selections. We took advantage of the pool & hot tub the next morning before our flight, and would stay here again if it were our decision.

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere - not the usual Doubletree standard”
Reviews.Author: sunsaver
Reviews.Content: We were put up in this hotel by the airline as our flight was cancelled. The check-in could not cope with a plane load of passengers and we were all made to feel unwelcome - and no chocolate chip cookies! The wait for the restaurant which had a buffet, was over an hour, and they did not want to serve anything from the al a carte menu. By the time we got into the restaurant it was 9pm and quite empty even though the staff were telling everyone it was full. The staff were more interested in setting the tables for the next day than serving anyone. It was quite apparent that they wanted everyone to have the buffet food which looked very unappetising and as though some of it had been there for hours. Also, the buffet area was not very clean. We waited a long time, despite several requests, for someone to take our order. 30 minutes later our meal, which included a salad starter, still had not been served and no-one, especially the maitre d' seemed to care. In the end, we ate the 'breakfast' pack of which we were all provided with as the flight was going early the next morning. The restaurant could not cope and did not make any effort to try. The restaurant is supposed to be open until 10pm but I think they all wanted to go home early.

Reviews.Title: “Stay FAR AWAY... Hotel is infested with TICKS and FLEAS”
Reviews.Author: contrrus
Reviews.Content: We stayed here everytime we visited Miami for over 2 years. MY BIGGEST ISSUE.. Dog ticks and fleas trying to eat you alive on the beds. I have seen for myself, some guy with 2 BIG dogs, (not medium as written on the website) Dirty, wanting a nice groom, with ticks "vampiring" their skin... Other friends and colleagues told me abouyt this, they complaned in the past, but nothing happened.. This time we had just about enough.. cause there was one wandering around on my pillow (imagine if it got into my ear!!) Some of the staff is nice and courteous, some have very bad manners, especially at the front desk and the shuttle drivers, these drivers drive like maniacs, feels like your in the fast and the furious movie... and they tend to curse at you when you don't tip or if you don't tip enough. Housekeeping lady, sometimes on floor 8, sometimes 9.. Apparently hates it when the wifey is there, you get 1 towel instead of 2, room barely cleaned, soap thrown on the counter... I can go on for days.... The Parking thing, OMG, $7 per day.. are you guys crazy, and they guy at the gate wants you to pay $7 again before they 24hr period... Internet connection is whack... They only nice things about this hotel is the Breakfast, and the Miami airport view...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - convenient to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Hokiechip
Reviews.Content: Needed an airport near the hotel for an early morning flight and this one was perfect. Very helpful staff, nice and quiet rooms. Would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed there 3 times and love it every time.”
Reviews.Author: Ramblingwelove
Reviews.Content: I have hosted a banquet at the Doubletree every November for the past three years. Their customer service in catering is fantastic. This time I stayed in a king room with my husband. Great room with a comfortable bed. We had forgotten to put out room service tag for breakfast so we called and got no answer. Call the front desk, they apologized and said someone would call me. We were doubtful but 1 minute later our phone rang and it was room service. Being a Sunday morning they were very busy. The woman took my order efficiently and said it could take 40 min. 20 min later we got a call that our breakfast was on the way up. They are always polite and helpful. Close to airport but also to highway which can get you anywhere in town quickly. I will book them again for next year. Have never had a problem. Overnight parking is $7. Most other hotels are $13 to $30.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great welcome for the Weary Traveler”
Reviews.Author: PDWisconsin
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel after a full day of travel in my rental. They seemed to push the valet, as there was no good place to conveniently park to check-in. I ended up parking in a no-park zone to quickly check-in. After a smooth check-in, I was directed to a fairly remote lot to pay for parking (hate that). My room was basic. The bed was very comfortable. The carpet was filthy. The bathroom was tired. Decent channel selection with HD signal on big flat screen. The hotel looks like it was nice in the past. The fitness room was big, and had a lot of well maintained or newer equipment, and an extensive area for exercising, including a big selection of free weights. Loved the fitness center. Everything else was average at best, and a little disappointing to be honest.

Reviews.Title: “good value and location”
Reviews.Author: rmh1021
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel for an overnight layover. Hotel has a free airport shuttle. Room was clean. Staff were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Settle for Less”
Reviews.Author: lovetoTRAVEL44114
Reviews.Content: Lobby area, etc. Dirty and really needs a good cleaning! Guests sleep in the lobby, and hang out on soiled furnishings. Staff nice and friendly, but utterly slow and they don't get the customer experience. Business Center - of the 4 computers - 4 were broken. Rooms were at best one star - soild carpeting, outdated, and just make me feel like something would crawl if I turned off the lights. Clearly they don't have enough maintenance and housekeeping staff on board. Pool area was disgusting - unkept, and appeared unsanitary. Good price for the dollar, but you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Awesome Room, Great View, Nice Staff, Great Gym”
Reviews.Author: regina627
Reviews.Content: Would happily stay here again when in the Miami area. Great shuttle service from airport to Alamo Car rental to cruise port. Very nice bedding. Highly recommend this hotel. The resteraunt 777 had great fish for a reasonable price too. Really good gym with lots of equipment, and an indoor basketball court my husband just loved. The hot tub and pool were nice too. We had a really great experience here and we booked through priceline and got a great deal! A whole mall is connected to the hotel, its cool!

Reviews.Title: “Fair and honest review of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ljahn
Reviews.Content: I usually read tripadvisor review before getting into a new hotel I don't know and usually the reviews are not objective or people overreact to any problems they may have. So I try to give my honest and professional traveler review to help others decide. This hotel is right in front of the Miami International Airport, so don't expect to walk around to find fine shops or restaurants, this hotel is for people with rental cars or people that will use the shuttle to the airport. The rooms are big and clean, the beds are very comfortable and the wireless internet is free and fast. The staff was polite. Yes, you have to pay $7/day for self-parking which I don't like, but most other hotels near the airport charges a parking fee, so it's not uncommon. The elevator issue has been solved, They had two brand new and very fast elevators and a third was coming soon. So, if you want a clean and comfortable room near the airport for a fair price and with nice business facilities, this hotel fits the bill. If you want a hotel where you can walk around to nice restaurants or spend your honeymoon, this is not the hotel for you, just go to south beach and be prepared to pay $250/night

Reviews.Title: “Travel 100% for Work - Never seen poorer customer service”
Reviews.Author: FromNYinDC
Reviews.Content: So I got to the Miami airport and called to see what the shuttle to the hotel situation was. The lady told me to wait 1/2 hour, so I asked where the shuttle was that I have to wait 1/2 hour. Her lazy @ss wouldn't call the shuttle and was just like just wait outside. Of course, I stood outside for 1/2 hour and nope, the shuttle didn't come. Called the hotel back and this new lady finally called the shuttle man, and 5 minutes later, he showed me. The room and hotel itself is fine. I would say it's a 3 star hotel. I woke up Thursday morning and called room service, no answer. Call 5 minutes later, still no answer, left message. So called front desk, was informed they were busy because there's only one person working, was told to call 5 minutes later. Again, nothing, called the front desk again, lazy woman (I think from the night before) just reconnected me to nothing again. Called the front desk again, no one picked up. Called again, someone finally picked up, after complaining that I've been calling room service for the last 20 minutes and no one has picked up, the front desk finally decided to page room service. A couple minutes later, got a call back. So ridiculous. I just got the impression people are just really lazy at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not 3.5 Star”
Reviews.Author: travelbuff53
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline for one week 6/10, leisure. I have lived in Miami and still travel there at least four times a year. I specifically book hotels off the beach because i always rent a car and need parking freedom. This hotel has a parking concession, $7 a day additional, no exceptions. After booking I called the GM and left a message about the parking issue, He never returned my call. After I checked in the desk cleck assured me she would tell him. Upon entering my room he was on the phone. He claimed my phone number was invalid. I've had the same number and answering machine for 25years, he just ignored my message because this was a pre-paid room. The parking for this hotel should be included in the room rate. They have ample unused space. It's not 3.5 star service.

Reviews.Title: “OK for one night”
Reviews.Author: purcfin
Reviews.Content: Layover in Miami after Mission work in Haiti, so I was looking forward to a restful evening. Check-in was slower than it should have been mid-afternoon, and upon getting to room hooking up to their wireless network was problematic (I guess I was too far down the hall to get a strong signal but that should be considered when it was installed). The business center was not well supervised, as both printers were not functioning. Please beware there is very little in the way of commerce such as open later eateries or stores within walking distance other than in the hotel. Also, I don't find the soft pillow top mattresses particularly comfortable and did not sleep all that well. On the positive side, the rooms were spacious and relatively clean, and the pool area was very nice. The price was right through a third-party site, but would not intentionally schedule a room here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: ginga
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned after reading some of the reviews, but our pre-cruise stay was great. The shuttle picked us up at the airport and helped with bags. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated, the elevators worked well and room service breakfast was quick and tasty. We had drinks in the comfortable seating area near the bar and a good but expensive dinner in the restaurant. The fitness center was great and the pool was fine. The concierge arranged a reasonably-priced van service to the pier that had a trailer for luggage. We needed it! And freshly-baked cookies were available at the front desk. To reassure those of you who read about bedbugs on a previous post, I did a search of my room, as I always do these days in hotels, and there was absolutely no evidence of bedbugs. The bed was very comfortable and I slept like a baby.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay- Nice Hotel- Please do not let other reviews discourage you!”
Reviews.Author: dfwbrown
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the DoubleTree Miami Mart Hotel during March 2010. After placing a bid on priceline.com and then reading the previous reviews of this hotel, I must say I was very worried and anxious of the stay. Upon arrival the hotel desk workers were very friendly. Upon receiving our room key and heading to the room, we were pleased to see that we had indeed received a non-smoking room with a King size bed (as I had requested via telephone call to the hotel directly). However, I soon noticed that our room was facing the landing area for the Miami Airport. So I decided to call down to the front desk to request a room change to something on the oppposite side of the airport. The request was quickly noted and I was advised that I could immediately obtain a key to the new room. (Very helpful in my mind- opposite of those opinions listed in previous reviews). We chose not to pay $12.00 a day valet fee but instead parked in the parking lot directly next to the hotel with "in-and-out" priviliges for $8.00 a day. The parking lot is neither dark nor extremely lit but does have a security guard on premises at all hours of the day/night. The bed and multitude of pillows were very comfortable. The TV was not the "latest and greatest" but on my vacation I did not plan on sitting infront of it all day anyway! The bathroom is a moderate size with a seperate area right outside (which was accomodating while 2 people were getting ready each day). The ONLY issue that we came across was the renovation of the elevators. There are 3 elevators total but only 2 are in use. Out of the 2 in use, there were times throughout the day that 1 would break down and would make coming to/from your room longer than needed. OVERALL: Our experience with the DoubleTree Miami Mart Hotel was a very pleasant surprise after reading all the negative reviews listed. If you are like me and would get worried prior to your stay, please do not take all of the negative comments to heart. Most individals will only take the time to post on websites such as this whenever they are frustrated and most individuals who had a nice visit forget to advise others of their own stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but older hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelmaven1
Reviews.Content: We were in one of their larger rooms. It was spacious and comfortable.TV was not a flat screen. The bathroom was a standard small room with only one sink. When the restaurant and the food at the bar becomes unavailable ( about 11:00 PM) you can still order from room service. The bar has some comfortable seating areas. Its good for relaxing with a beer or wine. Breakfast staff were very helpful. I was able to special order eggs even though breakfast was buffet style. We used the shuttle which runs every half hour. It is located a few miles form the airport. We took the shuttle back to the airport in the morning to rent a car since a previous post warned of the parking fee. We was told its not in a great neighborhood but we did not venture out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't like it!”
Reviews.Author: enriquep100
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is not in good shape, the guy who checked me in seemed like he was doing a sacrifice and when I asked him to add my mileage program to the reservation he got angry with me. Unfortunately he was the same guy who checked me out the next morning. On a side note, he was clearly a Spanish-speaking person. When I addressed him in Spanish, he was offended and replied back in English. The Elevators were horrible; the Rooms, ok, but the TV and remote in definitely a horrible shape. Nice cookies (warm), by the way. This hotel needs improvements. I wouldn't choose it again for the time being.

Reviews.Title: “Get ready to get hammered with unexpected charges”
Reviews.Author: jh635csi
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, but for some reason the entire hotel is very dark. They charge you for parking in a vacant parking lot and you have no other option but to park there, I decided to go to the bar for a drink and dinner. When I got the bill, I noticed that they included the 15% tip in the price. Never again, there are too many other properties in Miami to have to deal with this.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianCooky
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before leaving for 1 week in the Domincan Republic. Reception and check in were great, and the cookies were yummy! Hotel common areas were clean and well kept overall. Elevators were obviously from another generation, but were in the process of being renovated. Our room (309) smelled damp and the carpet was wet. Woke up at 4:15 am to get ready for our 7 am flight, only to discover lots of BED BUGS crawling all over the bed and padded head board. Ran into the bathroom to discover other bugs there as well. We captured a few in a tissue and went down to confront reception. Hotel staff quickly appologized and refunded our night's stay. Seemed like they knew about the problem...... I will never stay at a Doubletree hotel again, especially this one! Watch out if you are in room 309, or any room at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for staying if your quickly stopping over in Miami”
Reviews.Author: loloa312Austin
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Doubletreefor one night. I arrived in Miami very late at night so I booked a nearby hotel in order to just get to sleep quickly. The room was very nice, especially for the price I paid. My only complaint was that the mall next door is quite cheesy, and the elevators need a lot of maintanence! (Which I believe they were going to start working on according to their signs when I stayed" I wouldn't necessarily stay their for my vacation. But for a business trip or if you are just stopping over for one night I would highly recommend it! BONUS: THe cookies at Check-in are VERY delicious YUM!

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff; a bit far from airport”
Reviews.Author: longhorn_mike
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here one night when our airline put us up after a missed flight connection to Peru. It's actually a few miles from the airport terminals, so location could be better. The shuttle departs from the hotel every 30 minutes. Service from the staff was the highlight for us. They helped me with re-booking my Peru accommodations over the phone in Spanish. Free wi-fi in the room was also helpful. My biggest complaint was the business center. The computers were extremely slow, and the scanner wasn't working when I needed it. I'm very grateful for the help that the staff provided; however in the future I may try to find something closer to the airport if I have another overnight layover in Miaim.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and the wholesale mall is an extra plus!”
Reviews.Author: ticalinda10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my daughters before going on a cruise. The hotel is very nice and modern and clean. The staff was very nice and helpful. We really enjoyed having the wholesale mart attached to the hotel. We did some last minute shopping and found some great deals in clothing on the 2nd floor and accessories and this helped pass the time in our quick stay in Miami. We will definitely stay here next time I make a quick stop in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel...more than what's needed for a short overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn333
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Miami Mart between arriving in Miami on a late night flight (that was delayed, and ended up not getting us there until 2am) and an early morning flight to Puetro Rico. It was a beautiful hotel; they give you a delicious warm cookie when you arrive and had a very nice (but not free...or inexpensive) breakfast buffet. Our room was very clean and the staff were helpful and friendly (much appreciated at 3am).
