The hotel wasn't as close to the airport as I expected, and it's a bit more than what we needed for a 4 hour sleep and a place to shower. However, if I was going to stay in Miami for a few nights or a week, this would definitely be a top choice!

Reviews.Title: “Average at Best with Hidden Costs”
Reviews.Author: SurfTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently - I had booked for two nights but left after only one and stayed elsewhere. This hotel looks dated and older, and is located in a part of the city that appears to lack any nearby amenities. In other words, it if isn't directly at this hotel, you'll be driving to it. The hotel is attached to some sort of "mini-mall" or something, but when I checked in and walked over to see if there was anything there to buy to eat, it was closed up tight and kind of creepy. That left only the hotel restaurant and the bar, and after a long day of business, I didn't want to have to deal with that or the expense. So, walked outside (to find nothing) and wound up buying a meal bar at a nearby convenience shop in a gas station. This hotel appears old. The elevators appear to be ancient, and one was not working when I was there "for upgrading" (hopefully that means outright replacement). The room was decent, but not impressive. Clean though. You have to pay to park here - very annoying for a hotel guest, particularly one who is a Hilton Honors member. Then, you have to pay for internet service in the room ($9.95 for 24 hours), which has become a business travel "pet peeve" of mine - while many/most hotels now provide free internet service, why do some continue to charge like they're providing something special (particularly a large hotel chain)? This is hard for me to figure out in this day and age, and hotels should know they're losing customers for it. When you add in these "hidden charges", this hotel isn't the cheaper alternative that it appears when doing the research on the net (which was why I chose this place for business travel - the cost). Checked out the next morning, and checked in later that day at another chain hotel not too far away (a Holiday Inn Express), which provided exactly what I was looking for in business travel - a nice room (bigger, two room suite), FREE internet service (wow, what a novel concept!!), and FREE parking (even had a guard traveling around in the lot, so don't tell me the extra charge is required for security). And, for a slightly lower price than the Doubletree. Nothing really wrong with this hotel - I would rate it average at best. If you were staying near the airport, or had some function at this hotel, it would be fine. Just nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Correctible Miscues, Needs Upgrade of Exposition Space / Ammenities, BUT Pleasant Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Brison
Reviews.Content: Nice aesthetic improvements have been made to the public area, bar, restaurants and rooms. Staff is extremely pleasant. However, I experienced some housekeeping miscues in the week that we attended a conference there. FYI - There can be highway road noise associated with some rooms, so request a quiet area. I had my own wireless internet connection, but I was told by our companions that the daily in-room internet charges were high, so be sure to ask. Lighting in the room was a problem for me. Even with replacement light bulbs sent up by housekeeping, the lighting was insufficient for me. Bathroom lighting was particularly poor for grooming / cosmetic application. The security latch on the balcony sliding glass door was dangling by the 1 remaining screw, completely inoperable. That lack of basic security is dangerous because anyone could hop over the low adjacent balcony walls and waltz into our room. The lack of privacy from people on the adjacent balconies was surprising. Our entire room, computers, business equipment, and other valuables were completely visible by from the adjacent balconies. We kept the drapes closed, and maintenance repaired the security latch immediately. The bathrooms have been nicely updated, but the job had not been finished. The lavatory water faucet handles were not secured to the counter, and could not be turned off completely. The water in the shower / tub could not be turned off completely, either. Maintenance took care of those issues immediately. Housekeeping was absent 2 consecutive days. Housekeeping's response to my request for towels, shampoo, and restocking of the coffee bar resulted in a nighttime drop off of a sack of coffee bar items, a week's worth of towel stacked on top of the toilet, 3 shampoos, and 6 bars of soap. (Interesting!) Oddly, the bedroom clock is tethered to a bedside table on the bathroom side of the bed. This forces ALL guests to sleep on exactly the same side of the bed, in the same spot. This hotel has not yet adapted the practice of using washable duvet covers instead of blankets and spreads. On my bed there was a spread and bare, lightweight comforter WITH NO COMFORTER (duvet) COVER . You have to wonder if that comforter is ever going to be washed........ Like many hotels in this economy, the Doubletree cut the staff in the bar and restaurants down to one server. Be prepared to wait. However, I must say that the staff was pleasant and the food was good. The salmon was delicious, as were the desserts. Four of us ordered their version of "Conch Chowder" which was a beef-broth vegetable soup, with no discoverable conch. I met several business colleagues after hours in the bar area, which is attractive and comfortable. Twice in 2 days, I had to send wine back because it was immediately apparent by touch that crud was coated on the outside of the dirty glasses. The convention set-ups were tired, dated, and the rooms lacked an aesthetically pleasing atmosphere. The booth curtains, stage draping, and table skirting did not look fresh. The stage draping and table skirting was hastily attached and falling off in numerous places. Would I recommend this hotel for their convention services? No.... Not until they invest in more professional quality, updated conference / exposition ammenities. Would I stay at this hotel if I needed an inexpensive airport layover spot? Yes, if the price was competitive. Again, this hotel has very nice personnel working there from top to bottom. If you can roll with the miscues and give the staff the opportunity to make amends, you will be satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but noise from airport”
Reviews.Author: Sutter
Reviews.Content: At $65 plus taxes and fees from Hotwire, the hotel was worth the price. Room was plenty large. The hotel is certainly not new, but saw no particular signs of wear and tear or dirtiness. We ate dinner at the bar. Selection was fine. I did ask for a quiet room and when I saw our room was facing the airport I almost asked for a new room, but we were tired and I heard no noise at the time, so kept the room. However, I did near airplane noise 2-3 times in the early morning hours, so if I returned I'd ask for a room facing away from the airport. Hotel seemed further away from the airport terminal, via shuttle, than others I'd stayed at. There were lots of small stores in the attached "mart" area just outside the lobby, but they were not open by the time we left in the morning. Use of the computers in the business center was free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - but stay away from the ATM”
Reviews.Author: travel_girl347
Reviews.Content: I had a great time staying at the hotel. Its right in the middle of a lot of points of interest - shopping malls, South Beach, the everglades, the airport & public transit. The staff was friendly and the room was spacious and bright. I used the ATM that's near the hotel lobby and it short changed my $20. Other than that, I think I had a great time at Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: gaineh
Reviews.Content: Before my trip, I read the reviews about this hotel and most of the reviewers mentioned having issues with their room keys. Well I was pleasantly surprise to see that they have installed brand new key/lock system. It was a great value and the people were fantastic.
